Description.Name: Pirates Ambush the Argo
Description.Details: Blaring klaxons interrupt an otherwise quiet morning routine as several fast-moving ships appear, pacing the Argo. Darius broadcasts their hail to the bridge. "You're flying through our space, strangers. It's awfully dangerous out here. Just awful, especially for a ragged-looking ship like… the Argo. Tell you what, we'll provide you with a safe passage. For a price, of course." While you consider your options, Sumire pipes up. "Commander, if you can buy me some time, I could do a rapid fire-up of the Leopard. That'll teach them not to mess with us."

Description.Name: Lose C-Bills & Morale
Description.Details:
Swallowing your pride, you approve the payment. The look of disappointment on Sumire's face echoes that of the rest of the bridge crew.

Adding insult to injury, the voice over the bridge's speaker drips with satisfaction. "A wise decision, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.  Come now, don't look so shocked that I know you name.  I make it my business to know who's flying around in my backyard."

As the pirate ships disappear into the starry distance, you turn to Darius, "Who were they and how the hell do they know who we are?"

Darius looks up from his panel and shrugs, "We have no record of them in our database.  Even their ships had no markings or insignia.  The only reference I can find about bandit activity in this region refers to some elusive individual that goes by the name of Jamie Rayson and his partner Mr Bubbles and even that is nothing more than rumours."

Description.Name: Stall until the Leopard is ready.
The pirates flee
Description.Details: You stare at the pirate on the viewscreen, his visage obfuscated by an obvious cloaking filter, before answering, "So how do we know you'll leave us alone if we pay you?" The figure responds, "Well, to be frank, you don't. But you haven't pissed me off yet, so I am willing to just take my payment and let you be on your way... keep at it, and well, you'll see just how much chaos I can cause." Just then, the Leopard leaps free from its docking collar on the side of the Argo and fires a barrage of LRMs at the pirate ships. The ships evade the missiles, and returns fire at the Leopard and Argo. The dance continues until a particularly accurate barrage from the Leopard severly cripples one of the bandit ships. The remaining ships form up around their wounded comrade and they peel off away from the Argo, the mysterious figure sending one final broadcast, "I see you wish to test my resolve, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Mark my words, we will meet again." As the pirate ships disappear into the starry distance, you turn to Darius, "Who were they and how the hell do they know who we are?" Darius looks up from his panel and shrugs, "We have no record of them in our database. Even their ships had no markings or insignia. The only reference I can find about bandit activity in this region refers to some elusive individual that goes by the name of Jamie Rayson and his partner Mr Bubbles and even that is nothing more than rumours."

Description.Name: The pirates flee but a MechWarrior is injured
Description.Details: You stare at the pirate on the viewscreen, his visage obfuscated by an obvious cloaking filter, before answering, "So how do we know you'll leave us alone if we pay you?" The figure responds, "Well, to be frank, you don't. But you haven't pissed me off yet, so I am willing to just take my payment and let you be on your way... keep at it, and well, you'll see just how much chaos I can cause." Just then, the Leopard leaps free from its docking collar on the side of the Argo and launches a barrage of LRMs at the pirate ships. The ships evade the missiles, and return fire at the Leopard and Argo. The concetrated laser blasts pepper the Argo and the whole ship groans activating emergency systems. The dance continues until a particularly accurate barrage from the Leopard severly cripples one of the bandit ships. The remaining ships form up around their wounded comrade and they peel off away from the Argo, the mysterious figure sending one final broadcast, "I see you wish to test my resolve, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Mark my words, we will meet again." Darius calls out, "Commander, we have sustained minor damage and reports of injured personel throughout the ship, including [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], who was caught in one of the blasts. {SCN_MW.Subj_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:have been|Default:has been} taken to MedBay." As the pirate ships disappear into the starry distance, you turn to Darius, "Who were they and how the hell do they know who we are?" Darius looks up from his panel and shrugs, "We have no record of them in our database. Even their ships had no markings or insignia. The only reference I can find about bandit activity in this region refers to some elusive individual that goes by the name of Jamie Rayson and his partner Mr Bubbles and even that is nothing more than rumours."

Description.Name: The pirates flee but Argo Damaged
Description.Details: You stare at the pirate on the viewscreen, his visage obfuscated by an obvious cloaking filter, before answering, "So how do we know you'll leave us alone if we pay you?" The figure responds, "Well, to be frank, you don't. But you haven't pissed me off yet, so I am willing to just take my payment and let you be on your way... keep at it, and well, you'll see just how much chaos I can cause." Just then, the Leopard leaps free from its docking collar on the side of the Argo and launches a barrage of LRMs at the pirate ships. The ships evade the missiles, and return fire at the Leopard and Argo. The concetrated laser blasts pepper the hull as explosions near the engines resound throughout the Argo. The dance continues until a particularly accurate barrage from the Leopard severly cripples one of the bandit ships. The remaining ships form up around their wounded comrade and they peel off away from the Argo, the mysterious figure sending one final broadcast, "I see you wish to test my resolve, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Mark my words, we will meet again." Darius calls out, "Commander, we have sustained external damage to the Argo." As the pirate ships disappear into the starry distance, you turn to Darius, "Who were they and how the hell do they know who we are?" Darius looks up from his panel and shrugs, "We have no record of them in our database. Even their ships had no markings or insignia.
